scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is sitting reading a book and hears the bed in
Joey's room creaking, and does a 'Oh no, not again' look on his face.]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (from bedroom) WHOAA!!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: (going to the bedroom) See Joe, that's why your parents told you not to jump on the bed.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are entering]

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey, look at me. I'm making jam, been at it since 4 o'clock this morning.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Where'd you get fruit at four in the morning?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Went down to the docks. Bet ya didn't know you could get it wholesale.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: I didn't know there were docks.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Aww, is it broken?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, I gotta wear this thing for a couple weeks. (points to the sling he is wearing)

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Did you tell the doctor you did it jumping up and down on your bed?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Nooo. I had a story all worked out but then Chandler sold me out.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I'm sorry Joe. I didn't think the doctor was gonna buy that it just *fell* out of the socket.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: What is this? Fruit?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Monica's making jam.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Whoa, jam! I love jam! (to Chandler) Hey, how come we never have jam at our place?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Because the kids need new shoes.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm going into business people. I'm sick and tired of being depressed about Richard. I needed a plan, a plan to get over my man. What's the opposite of man? Jam. (sees Joey trying some jam from the pot) Oh Joey don't! It's way to hot. (Joey realizes this and spits what he had in his mouth back into the pot.)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: This will just be my batch.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Street, Phoebe is being followed by some guy, as they pass a flower vendor.
Phoebe turns around and the guy quickly picks up some flowers and continues following
her.]

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (turns around) Um, that's it. No. Hey! You! J. Crew guy. Yeah. Why have you been following me? I mean, all week long everywhere I look there's you.

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: You wouldn't return my calls, you sent back my letters....

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: One more chance Ursula, please?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oooh. Oh, well this is awkward.

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Wh..

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, yeah, you want Ursula, and I'm Phoebe. Twin sisters! Seriously.

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Oh, that's great. I'm stalking the wrong woman. I am such a dingus!

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, you're not a dingus.

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: I just, I want you to know I didn't used to be like this. Before I meet your sister I was like this normal guy who sold beepers and cellular phones.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Well, I mean look it's, it's not your fault, you know. I mean this is just what, what she does to guys, okay.

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Well thanks. (starts to leave)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Wait, (grabs him) you know what, I got a little story. When I was in Junior High School I went through this period where I thought I was a witch. And there was this guidance counselor who said something to me, that I think will help you a lot. He said okay, 'you're not a witch you're just an average student.' See what I'm saying?

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Not really.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, well, get over it. So, I mean you, you just seem to be a really nice guy, you know. Don't be so hard on yourself okay.

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Wait. You're right. I know you're right. And, thanks for being so nice. Here (gives her the flowers he bought.)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, thanks a lot. Do you want to get a cup of coffee?

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Yeah, okay.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay. (they start to leave, he is still following her) Okay, you don't have to walk behind me any more.

dialogue.speaker: GUY
dialogue.text: Sorry.

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are entering]

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Mon?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Mon?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (reading) 'Gone for more jars. Back later. Monica Geller.'

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Wait a minute, look.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, look, look.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: What, what, what?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: It's an empty apartment.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oooh.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: We're all alone in an empty apartment.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Honey, come on, I have to be at work in like ten minutes (Ross starts kissing her neck) Oh, all right, well it's not like I'm employee of the year or anything. (they fall onto the couch)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: There it is.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh, oh, that's what you're talking about. (to Chandler) Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Do I look fat?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS AND RACHEL
dialogue.text: Noo.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, I accept that. When Janice asked me and I said no, she took that to mean that I was calling her a cow.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Okay, walk us through it, honey, walk us through it.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, well. Janice said 'Hi, do I look fat today?' And I, I looked at her....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Whoa, whoa, whoa. You looked at her. You never look. You just answer, it's just a reflex. Do I look fat? Nooo! Is she prettier than I am? Noo! Does size matter?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Nooo!

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: And it works both ways.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, so you both just know this stuff?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well you know, after about thirty or forty fights, you kinda catch on.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, for instance. Let's say, Janice is coming back from a trip and she gives you two options. Option number 1 she'll take a cab home from the airport. Option 2 is you can meet her at baggage claim. Which do you do?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That's easy, baggage claim.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (buzzes) Wrong! Now you're single. It's actually secret option number three, you meet her at the gate. That way she knows you love her.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, this is good, this is good. All right listen, I have one. Janice likes to cuddle, at night, which, you know I'm all for. But, uh, you know when you want to go to sleep, you want some space. So, uh, how do I tell her that without, you know, accidentally calling her fat or something.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh honey, I'm sorry we can't help you there, 'cause we're cuddlily sleepers. (Chandler makes an 'Ewww' face) Okay, I'm late for work.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: All right are you guys gonna come down?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Uh, yeah, yeah I'll, I'm right behind you.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Good luck Chandler.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Thank you Rachel.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Bye sweetie.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Bye hon.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (blows her a kiss) Okay the sleeping thing. Very tricky business, but there is something you can do.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, I thought you guys were cuddlily sleepers.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Noo! No, not cuddlily, not me, just her. I'm like you, I need the room. Okay, come here. (they sit on the couch and Ross puts his hands on Chandler's shoulder and thigh.) Okay, you're in bed...

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah. (they both notice where his hands are)

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm gonna use the cushion.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Okay, you're in bed. She's over on your side, cuddling. Now you wait for her to drift off, and then you hug her (demonstrates on the cushion) and roll her back over to her side of the bed. And then you rollll a-way. Hug for her! Roll for you.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, the old hug and roll.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Yep.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Okay, one question.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Shoot.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You're pretending the pillow's a girl right?

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Joey is putting jam on his muffin, lots of jam]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Remember when you where a kid and your Mom would drop you off at the movies with a jar of jam and a little spoon?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (Looks at him) You're so pretty.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Hi!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey, Phoebe.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Hey, oh, you know that guy who's been following me? I talked to him today.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (with food in his mouth) You talked to him. Are you crazy?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, first I'm not crazy. And second, say it don't spray it. Anyway his name is Malcom, and he wasn't following me, I mean he was, but 'cause he thought I was Ursula, ick. And, that's why, that's why he couldn't just come up and talk to me. 'Cause of the restraining order.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Umm, not feeling better 'bout Malcom.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Ooh! No, no, no, no, he's not like a kook, no. He's just like this, this very passionate, incredibly romantic guy, that got like a tinsy bit carried away, you know. And we just get along really well, and he's so cute.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Oh my God, you've got a crush on your sister's stalker.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, I'm just gonna help him, you know, get 'de-Ursula-ized', like you know, like I did for Joey after he went out with her.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (with his mouthful) Hey, I didn't stalk her. I mean (he sprays Phoebe with crumbs)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Okay, I asked for the news, not the weather.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering) Hey guys.

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey Mon.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey, this is for you. (gives him a jar of jam) It's blackberry curin.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Aww. (tastes it) Ohh!

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Hey, Joe, I gotta ask. The girl from the Xerox place buck naked (holds up one hand), or, or a big tub of jam. (holds up the other hand)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Put your hands together.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey, take your time with that. That's my last batch.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No more jam?!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Well, what happened to your jam plan?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I figured out I need to charge seventeen bucks a jar just to break even. So, I've got a new plan now. Babies.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Well, your gonna need much bigger jars.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What are you talking about?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I'm talking about me having a baby.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Are you serious?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah. The great thing about the jam plan was, I was taking control of my life. So I asked myself, what is the most important thing to me in the world and that's when I came up with the baby plan.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Well, aren't you forgetin' something? What, what, what is uh, what is that guy's name? Dad!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: It took me 28 years to find one man that I wanna spend my life with, if I have to wait another 28 years then, I'll be 56 before I can have a baby, and that's just stupid.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: That, that's what's stupid.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I don't need an actual man, just a couple of his best swimmers. And there, there are places you can go to get that stuff.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Down at the docks again?

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Chandler's bedroom, Janice and him are cuddling]

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Night-night Bing-a-ling.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Night-night.....Janice. (he starts thinking to him self) 'Look at all that room on her side, you good fit a giant penguin over there. That would be weird though. Okay, hug and roll time. I'm huggin', I'm huggin', your rollin', and....yes! Freedom! (his one arm is still under her) Except for this arm! I'm stuck. Stuck arm! Okay, time for the old table cloth trick, one fluid motion. Quick like a cat, quick like a cat! And 1...2...3!' (Pulls his arm out from under her and she is spun off of the bed.)

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Central Perk, Malcom is giving Phoebe all of his spy stuff]

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: Here's my binoculars.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, great. Great. You're doing great, you know real strong. Going strong. Keep going.

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: These are my night vision goggles. This is the book I pretend to read when I'm watching her in the park. And these are Mad Lips, they're just for fun.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, yeah. What's this? (picks up a book)

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: Oh, this is log I kept, recording her every movement. Do you wanna here something from it?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, not even a little bit.

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: It's about you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, okay then.

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: (reading) I met Phoebe today. She was really nice to me eventhough I'm such a loser. And, then when I was walking home I thought about her a lot, it was weird, but kinda cool.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Good. So what were you thinking?

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: I was thinking what it would be like to kiss you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Really?

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: No.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh.

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: See that's just something I said now, so that maybe I could kiss you.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, okay. (he kisses her)

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is eating jam straight out of the jar, and Chandler
is staring at him in amazement. Joey offers him some.]

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: No, that's all right. I just had a jar of mustard.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: (entering from her bedroom) Okay, sperm donor number 03815, come on down! Okay, he's 6'2", 170 pounds, and he describes himself as a male Geena Davis.

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: You mean there's more than one of us.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Look, you can't do this Mon. All right, if you do this, I'm, I'm gonna, I'm, I'm gonna.....

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: You're gonna what?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: I'm gonna tell Mom.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Honey, I'm sorry, but he's right. I love you, but you're crazy.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Crazy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?! Why? Why is this crazy? So this isn't the ideal way to something....

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (interrupting her) Oh, it's not the ideal way...

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Lips moving, still talking. I mean it may not be ideal, but I'm so ready. No, I-I-I see the way Ben looks at you. It makes me ache, you know?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Check it out!! Jam crackers!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Okay, all right, how's this? 27. Italian-American guy. He's an actor, born in Queens. Wow, big family, seven sisters, and he's the only....boy. (they all turn and look at Joey) Oh my God,

dialogue.speaker: UNDER PERSONAL COMMENTS
dialogue.text: 'New York Knicks, rule!'

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah, the Knicks rule!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Joey, this is you!

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Let me see. (goes over and looks at the form) Oh, right.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: When did you go to a sperm bank?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Well, right after I did that sex study down at NYU. (to Chandler) Hey, Remember that sweater I gave you for your birthday?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: And that's how you bought it?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Noooo, that's what I was wearing when I donated. I'm kinda surprised there's any of my boys left.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Well, honey, it is pretty competitive. I mean I've got an actual rocket scientist here.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Maybe, I should call this place and get them to put my 'Days of Our Lives' on here. You know, juice this puppy up a little.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: (entering) Hellooo!

dialogue.speaker: ALL
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: How's the maniac?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, well he's yummy. We did a little kissin'.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Phoebe, what are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, no, no, no, no. You know what, he's not into that stuff anymore. He quit for me.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Pheebs, this guy has been obsessed with your sister, for God knows how long, okay, you don't just give up something like that.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Look, he gave me his night vision goggles and everything.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: You're taking the word of a guy who has night vision goggles?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What, he's not still following her. Do you think he is still following her?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Pheebs, wake up and smell the restraining order.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: What are you saying I should do?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I think, that if you really like this guy, you should just trust him.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Thank you, Monica.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Orrr, you could follow him and see where he goes.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh, that's what I would do, forget mine.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Oh my God, what happened? (points to the cast on Janice's wrist)

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh. God, crazy Chandler. He spun me...off...the...bed!

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Wow! Spinning that sounds like fun.

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: Oh, (laughs) I wish. No, you know he was just trying Ross's Hug and Roll thing.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: (turns around, not amused) Ross's what?

dialogue.speaker: JANICE
dialogue.text: You know what, where he hugs you and kinda rolls you away and... Oh... my....God.

scenes.scene_description:
[Scene: Subway station, Phoebe is following Malcom by finding behind the pillars until
she comes up to one with a wire mesh garbage can next to it. Malcom stops and starts
walking the other way and passes Phoebe, who quick tries to hide behind the garbage can.
But, Malcom sees her.]

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: Phoebe?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yes? Yes! Oh.

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: What are you doing?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh, I was just here looking for, um, my um, my part of an old sandwich. Oh, here it is! Oh. (picks one up out of the garbage can.)

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: Were you following me?

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Um, perhaps. Yes! Yes, I'm sorry, I'm sorry. I was just afraid that you were still hung up on my sister.

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: So you spied on me. I can't believe you don't trust me. (Ursula walks past, and Malcom finds behind the pillar)

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Oh well, what do you know, there goes my identical twin sister. Just walkin' along looking like me. What, is this just like a freakish coincidence, or did you know she takes this train?

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: I'm sorry. I'm sorry. I tried to stop, but I couldn't. I'm so pathetic.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: No, no, it's not your fault. You know it's partly my fault, 'cause I made you quit cold turkey. Sorry, no. Okay, well, I mean, I can't date you anymore, 'cause your, you know (in a high pitched voice) Wow! But um, but I will definitely, definitely help you get over my sister. Okay, stalk me for a while. Huh? Yeah, and, and, and, I'll be like an Ursula patch.

dialogue.speaker: MALCOM
dialogue.text: Uh-huh, I don't know.

dialogue.speaker: PHOEBE
dialogue.text: Yeah, just, okay, look I'm going. Um, come on. Op, op, behind the pillar, which way am I gonna go?

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hey.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Where you going?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: To the bank.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sperm or regular?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Sperm.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: So you're really doing this, huh?

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Oh yeah, picked a guy, 37135.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sounds nice.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: 'Fraid so. Brown hair, green eyes...

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No kiddin', hmm.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: No, I-I figured you would've picked a blond guy.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really? Why?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I don't know, I just always pictured you ending up with one of those tall, smart blond guys, name like.... Hoyt.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Hoyt?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: It's a name, yeah. I saw you, you know, in this great house with a big pool.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Really, is he a swimmer?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: He's got the body for it.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: I like that. (Joey starts laughing) What?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: You guys ha

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: We do not have one of those signs.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sure you do, it was a gift from me. Oh! And you have these three great kids.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Two girls and a boy?

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Yeah!

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: And, and, and they wear those little water wings, you know. And they're, they're running around on the deck. Then Hoyt wraps this big towel around all three of them.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Sure! (Monica gets very depressed) But hey, you know this way sounds good too.

dialogue.speaker: MONICA
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: Oh Monica. (goes over and hugs her, then looks at the form and stops hugging her.) Wow, this guy's an astronaut. That would've been cool, (sees Monica) for like a day. (hugs her again).

scenes.scene_description: [Scene: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is finishing off the last of the jam]

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: I called the sperm bank today, they haven't sold a single unit of Tribianni. Nobody wants my product. I mean, I-I-I don't get it (tries to drink the rest of the jam out of the jar and gets it all over his face, on his chin, nose, etc.) Maybe if they met me in person.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Honey, you got a little thing on your...(points to her whole face)

dialogue.speaker: JOEY
dialogue.text: (wipes a little jam from the corner of his mouth) Did I get it?

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Yeah.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (entering) Hello.

dialogue.speaker: RACHEL
dialogue.text: Hello.

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: (sees Joey) Hey. (walks into the living room) Uh, Chan, can I uh, can I talk to you for a second?

dialogue.speaker: CHANDLER
dialogue.text: Sure. What's up?

dialogue.speaker: ROSS
dialogue.text: Just one uh, one additional relationship thought. Probably something your already familiar with, uh, women talk! (smacks Chandler over the head with a magazine)
